alert.note: Alert for Columbus; Robeson (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 16 at 7:44PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...Wind gusts over 40 mph could occur across Robeson, northwestern Columbus and southeastern Dillon Counties through 815 PM EDT... At 743 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Robeson Community College to near Lake View. Movement was east at 35 mph. Strong wind gusts over 40 mph could precede the storms. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Lumberton, Fairmont, Fair Bluff, Lake View, Boardman, Smiths, Howellsville, Hestertown, Barnesville, Robeson Community College, Barker Ten Mile, Kemper, Evergreen, Fork, Cerro Gordo, Marietta, Proctorville, Mcdonald, Orrum and Southeastern Regional Medical Center. This includes Interstate 95 in North Carolina between mile markers 9 and 26. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
